snippet: More than 15 years after it criminalized the purchase of sex while allowing its sale, Sweden continues to grapple with issues that could limit progress in reducing prostitution and trafficking.
abstract: Sweden's prostitution law, which criminalizes purchase of sex while allowing its sale, has been considered a success but some say law is forcing women into more dangerous situations, and has increased discrimination and stigma attached to prostitution.
lead_paragraph: More than 15 years after it criminalized the purchase of sex while allowing its sale, Sweden continues to grapple with issues that could limit progress in reducing prostitution and trafficking.

headline.main: Swedish Prostitution Law Targets Buyers, but Some Say It Hurts Sellers
headline.print_headline: Swedish Prostitution Law Targets Buyers, but Some Say It Hurts Sellers
